alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 11:12AM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by snowmelt and recent warm temperatures is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Mono. * WHEN...Until noon PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over mountain roads near creeks and streams. Hazards for backcountry recreation activities through this weekend in Mono County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1107 AM PDT, Gauge reports of several small streams in Mono county indicate flows remain high due to snowmelt. Cooler temperatures early this week should bring a slight decrease in stream flows by Monday afternoon through mid week, although streams are expected to remain elevated and fast. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mammoth Lakes, Mono Lake, Lee Vining, June Lake, Bodie, Crowley Lake, Toms Place, Benton, Bridgeport, Twin Lakes, Chalfant, Sonora Pass, Coleville, Crestview, Mammoth Mountain, Conway Summit, Benton Hot Springs, Robinson Creek Campground, Bridgeport Reservoir and Devils Gate Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded mountain roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can flow over their banks. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks, which can become dangerous to cross due to fast and cold flows.
